refnamediv.refpurpose: Find indices and values of nonzero elements

refsection.title: Particular cases
refsection.para: Matlab function can work with complex values what is not possible in Scilab, however, using abs it is very easy to have the same results.

para.note: Note that Scilab function can only return two output values and Matlab one can return a third value that can be computed according to the first two output matrices as explained in Matlab help.

refsection.para: For example, in [i,j,v]=find(X), v is equal to: X(i+(j-1))*size(X,1).

Another great difference between Scilab and Matlab is that Matlab returns column vectors of indices when X is a column vector or a matrix but Scilab always returns row vectors. For this kind of input, use matrix to get the same output value...what is done mtlb_find()
